tn.text: Parallelism is common in Hebrew poetry. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_poetry]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
This may refer to a style of music. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:psa:032:001|32:1]].
open place under the earth large enough for people to walk around in

tn.ref: I cry out for help to Yahweh ... I plead for Yahweh's favor
tn.text: If these two lines are so much the same that the reader will get the wrong meaning, you can translate them as one line. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: pour out my lament before him ... I tell him my troubles
tn.text: If these two lines are so much the same that the reader will get the wrong meaning, you can translate them as one line. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: pour out my lament before him
tn.text: The psalmist speaks of telling Yahweh why he is sad as if he were pouring all of a liquid out of a container. AT: "I tell him all about why I am sad" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"tell him about everything that makes me worry"

tn.ref: my spirit is weak within me
tn.text: "I am weak" or "I am extremely discouraged"

"you know the path I should take." The psalmist speaks as if what a person does were a path that that person walked along. AT: "you know the way I should live" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: In the way that I walk they have hidden a trap for me
tn.text: The psalmist speaks of people wanting to harm him as if they were trying to trap an animal. AT: "They are making plans so that whatever I do they can harm me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
This is a call for help. AT: "called to you now for help" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Possible meanings are 1) "all I want" or 2) "all I need" or 3) "all I have."

tn.ref: in the land of the living

tn.text: This is a call for help. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:psa:005:001|5:1]]. AT: "Listen to me as I call to you now for help" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: I have been brought very low
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) "I am very needy" and 2) "I am very weak." See how "we are very low" is translated in [[:en:bible:notes:psa:078:007|78:8]].

tn.ref: Bring my soul out of prison
tn.text: This is a request. AT: "bring me out of prison" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
The word "name" is a metonym for the person. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:psa:005:011|5:11]]. AT: "give thanks to you" See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
